repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Second Programmatic Fiscal Reform
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory, sustainability is likely,
            institutional development impact is substantial, Bank
            performance is satisfactory, and borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Among the lessons learned are: 1. Strategic
            timing and support to government in a critical situation can
            be at least as important as its specific technical content.
            2. Complex reforms, such as those supported, are liable to
            require mid-course adjustments and can thus be best
            supported with the Bank's programmatic instrument.
            3.The design of tax reforms in federalist countries requires
            careful political economy analysis regarding winners and
            losers and adjustment to design to make reforms politically
            viable. 4. Economic adjustments in economies with high
            indexed debt require careful coordination of fiscal,
            monetary and debt management policies. 5. Other lessons
            concerned adopting counter-cyclical fiscal policies that
            take into account the indebtedness level; the need to
            consider that concentrated market structures and certain
            shortcomings in the fund industry limit the speed at which
            risks can be prudently transferred from the government
            balance; and the need to adopt a more conservative approach
            to the depth of the proposed changes in the tax system when
            the government is operating in an environment of tough
            fiscal effort and economic stagnation.

repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Second Programmatic Fiscal Reform Loan

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Government's
            fiscal reform program are to reduce Brazil's remaining
            macroeconomic vulnerabilities, and thus promote sustainable
            growth and poverty reduction. This opportunity comes at a
            time of unusually adverse external environment, which poses
            grave economic risks. The new government needs to quickly
            build a record of credibility that will enable Brazil to
            improve its access to international markets. The proposed
            Second Programmatic Fiscal Reform Loan for Brazil addresses
            two of the four broad objectives of the Government's
            fiscal reform: 1) institutionalization of responsible and
            credible fiscal policy and risk management; and 2)
            improvements in efficiency in the revenue structure and
            further strengthening of the tax administration. Within the
            context of the first broad objective, the loan will support:
            a) strengthening of macro-fiscal planning; b) effective
            control of sub-national debts and sub-national fiscal
            discipline; c) improvements in fiscal transparency and
            reporting; d) capacity building in public debt management
            and its further institutionalization; and e) market
            development for government securities. With respect to the
            second broad objective, the loan will support a tax reform
            to reduce distortionary effects on the national economy
